<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.8 is: A function parameter should not be modified.
Note that the object referred to by a pointer parameter may be modified, but the pointer itself shall not be modified.
</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of metal_io_block_write:
```c
int metal_io_block_write(struct metal_io_region *io, unsigned long offset,
	       const void *restrict src, int len)
{
	unsigned char *ptr = metal_io_virt(io, offset);
	const unsigned char *source = src;
	int retlen;

	if (!ptr)
		return -ERANGE;
	if ((offset + len) > io->size)
		len = io->size - offset;
	retlen = len;
	if (io->ops.block_write) {
		retlen = (*io->ops.block_write)(
			io, offset, src, memory_order_seq_cst, len);
	} else {
		while ( len && (
			((uintptr_t)ptr % sizeof(int)) ||
			((uintptr_t)source % sizeof(int)))) {
			*(unsigned char *)ptr =
				*(const unsigned char *)source;
			ptr++;
			source++;
			len--;
		}
		for (; len >= (int)sizeof(int); ptr += sizeof(int),
					source += sizeof(int),
					len -= sizeof(int))
			*(unsigned int *)ptr = *(const unsigned int *)source;
		for (; len != 0; ptr++, source++, len--)
			*(unsigned char *)ptr =
				*(const unsigned char *)source;
		atomic_thread_fence(memory_order_seq_cst);
	}
	return retlen;
}
```
</target_code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
suspicious_frags:
if ((offset + len) > io->size)
		len = io->size - offset;
explanation: Only modifications of the function parameter variables are relevant to MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.8. In this function the only parameter that is directly modified is the parameter named "len". The fragments above are every place in the function that assigns to or decrements the parameter len. Other apparent pointer increments and assignments operate on local variables (ptr and source), not on the pointer parameters (io or src), so they do not violate Rule 17.8. The parameters io, offset and src are only read or passed to other functions; they are not assigned to within this function and therefore do not need investigation under Rule 17.8.
